boardgame.description: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;History punishes those who come too late._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; - Mikhail Gorbachev_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;1989: Dawn of Freedom is an exciting, fast paced game simulating the end of the Cold War in 1989. During this amazing year, a series of democratic revolutions ended the 40 year Soviet empire in Eastern Europe. 1989 simulates the political, social and economic aspects of these revolutions using a card-driven system similar to Twilight Struggle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;No man is so old he cannot live one more year._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; - Leszek Kolakowski_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One player plays the Communist. At the start of the game he holds unquestioned power across the six nations of the Warsaw Pact. But there are ominous clouds on the horizon. The new leader in Moscow has declared no more will Soviet tanks prop up tottering Communist governments. The economies, after decades of central planning and stagnation, have reached various stages of crisis. Inside the churches and among the students and their professors there are dissident movements that have been emboldened. From crushing dissent to offering concessions, the Communist player will have to use a variety of strategies in a struggle to hold on to his empire._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;A bad regime is never in so great danger as when it tries to improve._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; - Alexis de Tocqueville_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The other player plays the Democrat. At the dawn of 1989, behind the iron curtain, no one considers revolution possible. The goal of dissidents is to create a civil society outside the control of the Communist regimes. On their side are students who are fascinated with the style and pop culture of the west, and the Church. Against them is the vast apparatus of the Communist state. Their challenge is to persuade the workers, who are the bulk of society, to join their cause._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;Mr. Gorbachev, open this gate. Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; - Ronald Reagan_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Selling as not getting played. Any questions please ask. Postage as below.

Condition - New in shrink-wrap Payment by PayPal in advance or cash on pickup. For shipping this is considered a medium size game. The following options are available for delivery within the continental United States: 1) Local pickup in the San Jose, California area (no cost) 2) USPS Priority Mail Flat Rate - $6.60 (small), $12.65 (medium), or $17.15 (large), depending on game size. Generally very small games fit in the small box, small or medium in the medium box, and large in the large box. Box fits for some games are very snug, allowing minimal protective padding - if this shipping option is picked for such games seller assumes no responsibility for damage during transit. 3) USPS Parcel Select Ground / Non-Flat Rate Priority - varies, usually only cheaper than Flat Rate Priority for small and very light weight games (under 2 pounds), an additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. 4) FedEx Ground - varies, usually from $12 for short distance shipments of light weight games to $30 for heavy games (or multiple games up to 10 pounds) long distance shipments. This is usually the cheapest option for very large games. An additional fee of $3.25 for the box and packing materials will be added to the shipping costs. While expensive, this is the best method if damage during transit is a concern, as all items will be packed in boxes sufficiently sized for protective materials. Shipping rates to Alaska or Hawaii will be higher for FedEx. Games will not be shipped by any method other than a shipping box, nor unboxed or in less than complete condition, please do not ask.
Still in shrink. From a nonsmoking petfree home Shipping is 12.00 USPS Priority

Am parting with my LIKE NEW copy of GMT’s 1989: Dawn of Freedom to make room for new games. This game is in immaculate shape. Rule book crisp and hardly used (I make a copy of the living rules to use). Cards are sleeved. Game comes from a smoke-free, game-loving home. I have played this copy twice and really enjoyed it -- especially the battle system. This copy is currently out of print and it could be quite a while before it is ever reprinted. I have been a BGG member for years, but only sold a few times on BGG. You can see my buyer/seller feedback on eBay, seller ID _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;houlie63_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;. This method includes tracking information so you can track progress to your destination. Reach out to me if you require a different shipping method or have any questions prior to purchase. Thanks for looking.
